strapiPost.title: Arkansas Tourism Shows Resiliency as Revenue and Job Gains Outpace Inflation
strapiPost.content:
Arkansas's Tourism Ticker for 2022 by TB&P is out, and it's looking good for the travel and tourism sector.

  • Big ups: Benton County had a whopping 51.8% increase in tourism tax collections, while Washington County came in at a 36.2% increase over 2021, both outsized gains compared to other counties included in the report.
  • Jobs on track: The tourism sector in Northwest Arkansas saw monthly average employment of 27,010 in 2022, a 3.8% increase compared to the same period in 2021 and actually a smaller increase than other regions in the state.
